thread.title: The directors of Disney's Aladdin just confirmed this fan theory about the Genie
thread.title_full: The directors of Disney's Aladdin just confirmed this fan theory about the Genie

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: The directors of Disney's Aladdin just confirmed this fan theory about the Genie
text:
​Fans of ​Aladdin ​and Disney films listen up, because directors have just confirmed a major fan theory that's bound to delight the die-hards (assuming there are some die-hard Aladdin fans out there, right? Guys?).
There's nothing a fandom likes more than for one of their theories to be approved by the big honchos, and so it's good news all round now that directors John Musker and Ron Clements have given this particular one a thumbs up.
 Said fan theory involves the peddler at the beginning of the film holding the lamp, as many fans theorise that that is actually the Genie in disguise - namely because he was also voiced by the late Robin Williams, but also because he has just four fingers like the wish granter.
Speaking to E! news about the particular theory, Clements said:
"I saw something that speculates that the peddler at the beginning of ​Aladdin ​is the Genie. That's true! So, that's an urban legend that actually is true."
More From Cosmopolitan AMAZING.
​The peddler was apparently meant to be revealed as the Genie at the end of the film, but it never happened due to plot changes and final edits. ​
